course.subject: ENVR
course.name: Thinking Big: Systems Thinking for Environmental Problems
course.description: This course is about developing systems thinking skills to solve complex environmental problems. Systems thinking emphasizes the “big picture”, linkages and interactions. Through an activity-based course students will develop systems diagramming skills, concepts and find unconventional solutions for complex environmental problems.

reviews.author: Susan0323
reviews.comment_content: Actually, the content is not as hard as I thought it would be. So this makes it a little boring to attend every class. Most class have interesting and useful content though.
reviews.comment_teaching: Paul is sooooooo nice! It's very interesting and relaxing to listen to his sharing and talk with him (right, in class and also after).
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading scheme is quit transparent: 10% participation + 25% midterm + 15% project (5% presentation + 10% report) + 50% final
( if I remember correctly)
Both midterm and final are open-book exam, but do make sure you go through all materials or else you won't have enough time to look for answer.
The final grade is quite good.
reviews.comment_workload:
Before midterm, the workload is very light. There are just some reading materials. And after midterm, you have to start preparing for the project, so the workload will increase a little bit, but it really depends on the topic of your group project and how nice you want your project to be.
No quiz!!!

reviews.author: Soomin
reviews.title: Vague but easy course
reviews.comment_content: Manageable, very concept-based so you better take notes of real examples explained by the professor in class. If you like practical lecture with full of knowledge, this course is not recommended.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Forster is super chill and fun but gotta deliberately pay attention to class to not fall asleep. Sometimes it can be quite boring
reviews.comment_grading: Quite not transparent grading, but i think as long as you pay attention to class and do well on ppt, you can get above B
reviews.comment_workload: only one presentation, one mid term and one final. Very manageable. No assignment what-so-ever.

reviews.author: jackiechan
reviews.comment_content: The content itself is really vague, it focuses around systems diagrams with loops and mental mapping models such as the iceberg model. If you get the hang of it its okay but if you dont get it from day one you're screwed
reviews.comment_teaching: Paul is one of the best professors in UST. Super chill, passionate about his classes; you can feel his passion in teaching as a student.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is very light compared to other courses, there is a mid term and a final but its manageable, and there is one presentation

reviews.author: wyiLe
reviews.title: Be a system's thinker
reviews.comment_content: A lot of interesting things related to solving environmental problems or general problems will be taught. Mainly the System Diagrams helps a lot with problem solving and seeing problems in a more complete way.
reviews.comment_teaching: Paul is my all time favourite Prof. His way of teaching contents is really interesting, aside from teaching the course contents, he will also talk about a lot of other interesting facts that leads to all the problems we have today.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is really fair as long as you partipate in the class and revise for the Mid-term and Final exam. There is also a group project, it is related to selecting a envrionment problem, and by using the tools taught by the course, you will try to analyse and give solutions.

The exams are open resources (not electronics), so as long as you attend the classes and pay attention, you will be able to do the exams without a lot of difficulties. Some of the questions will require deeper understanding of the course materials, knowing how to draw the diagrams is a must.
reviews.comment_workload: For a CC, the workload is pretty fair, you will get readings almost every week, but they are not very long. The readings are quite interesting as well, you will be able to learn a lot of things in this course.

reviews.author: thatcindy
reviews.title: should take this course cuz its gooooood
reviews.comment_content:
System thinking
drawing causal loop diagrams


Problems that are ideal for a systems thinking intervention have the following characteristics:

-The issue is important.
-The problem is chronic, not a one-time event.
-The problem is familiar and has a known history.
-People have unsuccessfully tried to solve the problem before.

----> Global warming
Taking this course really helps you to see this problem from a whole mew perspective and take a more holistic approach when trying to solve it.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Paul is my favourite instructor and I look forward to attending his class so much
Interactive and fun
reviews.comment_grading: If you work hard enough the grade won't be bad haha
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is acceptable
thanks group mates for carrying

reviews.author: ssho
reviews.title: thought-provoking course
reviews.comment_content:
It is a fun and useful course about system thinking that the contents are useful in thinking about environment and life.

Common Core (S&T) for 2010 & 2011 3Y programs
Common Core (S&T) for 2012 3Y programs
Common Core (S&T) for 4Y programs
reviews.comment_teaching:
Paul is absolutely a good and kind professor that always there to help and his teaching methods are good and interacting.
However, sometimes you cannot get the meaning of the videos. A lot of video are shown in lessons.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is fine, I think the mean is around B
With attendance have a significant proportion towards the grade. Do not skip lessons easily.
reviews.comment_workload:
Nearly zero workload for the course except the group project and presentation
Midterm and final are open book exam so pay attendtion in lesson should be fine for exams already.

reviews.author: Clothing16
reviews.title: Nice course!!
reviews.comment_content:
The content is quite fun and you will enjoy it. Many video , but the exam focus more on the concept and how to apply them .
Many open end question and thought provoking.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Paul teaches the courses in a very interesting way.
I like this prof very very very very very much
reviews.comment_grading: I score really bad for the final but still get a B, though I have done fine for the mid term and project. I think overall the course is good grading.
reviews.comment_workload:
final and midterm but open-book
and project with presentation
I study hard but is still fine!
